alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Currituck , the southern City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the southern City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 445 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Back Bay, or 9 miles southeast of Virginia Beach, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Back Bay, Fentress, Norfolk International, Ghent, Bowers Hill, Norview, Northwest and Cradock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
